issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
container-executor.cfg has two properties related to dockerization. 
1)  module.enabled = true/false
2) docker.privileged-containers.enabled = 1/0

Here, both property takes different value to enable / disable feature. Module enabled take true/false string while docker.privileged-containers.enabled  takes 1/0 integer value. 

This properties behavior should be consistent. Both properties should have true or false string as value to enable or disable feature/
fields.summary: Add configuration consistency for module.enabled and docker.privileged-containers.enabled

comments.body: Thanks for filing, [~yeshavora]. Should be a straightforward fix. I think true/false is preferable to 1/0, since it is more readable. However, because we've shipped releases using 1/0, we should maintain this functionality for backwards compatibility.
also, as talked with Shane offline, it is better to make it case insensitive, like both "True" or "true" should work

Attaching a patch that allows for "true" or "True" for docker.privileged-containers.enabled and feature.tc.enabled. It also keeps the old 1/0 behavior. I tried to keep the code intact as much as possible, so it's not beautiful, but I could definitely optimize things more if you all think it's necessary.

Thanks for the patch [~ebadger]! Overall it looks good. Couple comments. I'm curious if using strcasecmp might give us more flexibility in how users define these? does that introduce portability concerns? or is the desire only to support true/True? Also, the documentation only refers to 0/1, I think that should be updated as well.

[~shanekumpf@gmail.com], [~eyang], thanks for the comments!

bq. I'm curious if using strcasecmp might give us more flexibility in how users define these
Yep, that seems like a good change to make. I'll fix that up

bq. Also, the documentation only refers to 0/1, I think that should be updated as well.
Will update that as well
Uploading new patch to address the above feedback.

Ran the test failures locally and they all passed for me. Plus, they're in the RM code, which this patch doesn't touch. So, I'd say they're unrelated.

bq. The default for tc should still be false.
Wow, that's a pretty bad mistake. Thanks for the catch

bq. There is and indentation issue on the last line.
Fixed. I'm pretty confused on indentation rules in C code for hadoop. It appears that the code doesn't follow the same rules as Java hadoop code. In container-executor.c, a bunch of if statements have the following lines indented 4 spaces, while it's only 2 in docker-util.c. Looks like the culprit might just be inconsistency in container-executor.c not always following the same rules as Java hadoop code.

bq. Should not we check for false as well and not fall back to a number in that case?
Yea, it's probably cleaner that way. I think it works right now because of how {{strtol}} interprets "false", but this makes it clear. Uploading a new patch with this fix
